main event: An unidentified flying object (UFO) was observed in Pueblo, Colorado on June 14, 1958 at 1016 MST. The object was described as solid, white or silvery white, with a rounded dome on the middle, and higher than cirrus clouds at 30,000 ft.
interesting points: The object was seen visually and tracked with a theodolite by a civilian witness.
The object was estimated to be moving at a very high speed, around 2000 feet per second.
There were no visible means of propulsion, no sound, and no trail observed on the object.
The sighting was followed aurally with a theodolite and visually, and the observation lasted about 3 minutes.
The witness mentioned that upper winds were from the southwest, opposite to the movement of the object, and two pilots also observed the object making a very rapid maneuver.
sighted object: an unidentified flying object described as solid, white or silvery white, with a rounded dome on the middle
photographs: no photographs were included in the report
